newsitem.title: USA: Fed seen adding reserves via 4-day system RPs.
newsitem.headline: Fed seen adding reserves via 4-day system RPs.

text.p: The Federal Reserve was expected to add temporary reserves to the banking system via a round of four-day system repurchase agreements Thursday, economists said.

The Fed already had injected permanent reserves to the banking system on Thursday by buying coupon securities. However, economists said its add need still was large and the Fed likely would come in at its usual midmorning period.
Fed funds were last trading at 5.50 percent, right at the Fed's current official target level.
